p: Neuroimaging techniques can also help to make the correct diagnosis and monitor the progress of NDs. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is one of the most widely used neuroimaging techniques used for AD ( Jack et al., 2011; McKhann et al., 2011) and for dementia with Lewy bodies (DLB) ( Ciurleo et al., 2014). Magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) has also showed promise in early diagnosis of PD and traumatic brain injury, measuring metabolic dysfunctions and irreversible neuronal damage ( Vagnozzi et al., 2008).
